data.title: 【Ended】11/14・11/15・11/16：Japanese College Fair 2023 FALL (Live Webinar・Free・Pre
data.meta_description: The latest information sessions on Japanese universities will be held online in Japanese and English.
data.meta_site_name: 海外に暮らす学生のための「日本の大学への進学＆留学ガイド」 - 外国生まれの子ども、新二世、帰国生の未来を応援するサイトです
data.text:
Eikei University of Hiroshima is a liberal arts university opened in 2021 publicly in Hiroshima. Courses are offered in English and students learn a wide range of courses such as Humanities, Economics, Natural Sciences (Environmental Studies), and acquire practical skills needed to solve real-world problems throughout taking Project-Based-Learning and experiential/practical programs. You can have the opportunity to learn actively to shape the future! We look forward to seeing you！

Hosei University is a private university with a history of over 140 years, and has and has three campuses in Tokyo, known as one of the leading Universities in Japan with a total of 15 faculties and 38 departments covering from science to humanities areas. It has 265 partner Universities in 45 countries and regions and also has more than 1,459 international students, making it a very global environment (as of March 2022). We also offer a variety of support for the students such as employment support and scholarship, so please do not hesitate to join us at the information session!

The International College of Liberal Arts (iCLA) at Yamanashi Gakuin University is a four-year, American style liberal arts college taught in English. We offer majors in Global Business & Economics, Political Science, Interdisciplinary Arts and Japan Studies. Students can also study a wide range of electives to supplement their major, as well as studying Japanese language and culture as part of the degree. We have a diverse student body coming from more than 50 different countries, in a beautiful setting with views of Mt Fuji just 90 minutes from central Tokyo. Join our information session to find out more!

My name is David Eckford, and I am an Australian who has lived in Japan for many years. I am also a graduate of Kindai University. I now work in the Global Education Center of the university, and I look forward to introducing you to what “Kindai” can offer you. Kindai University is a progressive and vibrant university with a multitude of study avenues and options that cater for many interests. Additionally, Kindai University is situated in the heart of the Kansai region, and this makes for easy access to Kyoto, Nara, Kobe, Wakayama, and more. We are a very short train ride from central Osaka, an area brimming with delicious restaurants, great shopping, and many things to see. I hope I will see you here on campus in the very near future.

Rikkyo University has a long and venerable history, and the university will soon celebrate the 150th anniversary since its founding in 1874. Rikkyo University’s new PEACE program initiative introduces three dynamic undergraduate programs that allow students to complete their degrees entirely in English. We invite you to come join the PEACE learning community on our lovely, serene campus in Ikebukuro, which seems a world away from the bustle of central Tokyo.

My name is Raynor, and I am from the International Admissions Office at Ritsumeikan University. We have undergraduate campuses located Kyoto and Osaka, which are all excellent places to live and study. We offer English-language based programs including dual/joint undergraduate degree programs in which students can earn bachelorʼs degrees from both Ritsumeikan and partner universities in Australia and the US. Join me to learn about the unique study opportunities in our five English-medium undergraduate programs.

Greetings, everyone! As one of the top Japanese private universities, Sophia University takes pride in its excellence in education and diverse campus, located in central Tokyo. We look forward to telling you all about our traditional history, renowned programs, and admissions. See you soon!

Located in the vibrant heart of Tokyo, Tokyo International University (TIU) offers English-medium Bachelor’s degree programs that aims at fostering global citizens. Our campus thrives as a dynamic international hub, with a diverse student body of over 6,500 students, including more than 1,500 international students from 100 different countries. TIU is committed to providing a comprehensive and immersive educational experience, making it the ideal starting point for your journey through Japan and beyond. Join our session to learn more about how TIU can help you launch your global career.

University of Tsukuba is one of the top national universities in Japan located in Tsukuba Science city. As the university “Open to the Global Society”, we are trying to accept more international students and returnee students. We hope many of you come to our information session! (Presenter – Professor Nakao Nomura)

At Waseda University, we place great importance on creating an environment that fosters the development of human resources, and we are committed to nurturing highly motivated students who will contribute positively to the world. Global leaders must acquire skills such as effective communication, cross-cultural understanding, creativity, problem solving abilities, and critical thinking to name a few. At Waseda University, students can acquire these skills. What’s more, currently there are approximately 7,000 international students from all over the world on campus, and there are many opportunities for them to interact with one another. In this session, we will provide you with information on admissions and Waseda’s English-based Degree Programs, which allow students to obtain degrees in six undergraduate departments and 15 graduate departments without any Japanese language requirement. We hope to see you there!

The YOKOHAMA Socrates Program at Yokohama National University (YNU) is a new undergraduate, bilingual global education program with both English and Japanese as common languages. Our campus is located in Yokohama, the second largest city in Japan after Tokyo, and within easy commuting distance from the capital. It is known for being one of the most international and culturally diverse cities in Japan. YNU itself is situated in the midst of lush green forest, hence the name, the “Oasis of Yokohama.” In this program, students will learn issues and analytical methods rooted in the humanities and social sciences related to the topics of social resilience and social sustainability. Our classes will be conducted in small interactive seminar styles using the Socratic method. We are looking forward to meeting you all at our information session!
